pageContext.claim: “I did the ban to Europe where I took a lot of hell...And it was, you know, something that by that time and that was very early. By that time, I felt -- I felt very confident we were doing the right thing. And we did the right thing.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump announced his restrictions on parts of Europe on March 11, more than a month after restrictions on non-U.S. citizens coming from China. So that's hardly "very early." In point of fact, Trump announced a bar on the entry of foreign nationals from the Schengen Area, the European Union’s border-free travel zone, a 26-nation region that does not include Britain, Ireland or 21 other European countries, including Croatia, Serbia, Romania, Ukraine and Russia. He later extended the restrictions to the United Kingdom and Ireland. He did not take "a lot of hell" for the announcement.
